sn11.25:1: Thus have I heard. On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta's Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika's Park. There the Blessed One said this:
sn11.25:2: v.945"‘Do not let anger overpower you;Do not become angry at those who are angry.Nonanger and harmlessness always dwellWithinthe hearts ofthe noble ones.Like a mountain avalancheAnger crushes evil people.’"[n.668]Spk: Nonanger(akkodha)is lovingkindness(metta)and the preliminary phase of lovingkindness; harmlessness(avihiṁsa)is compassion(karuṇā)and the preliminary phase of compassion.
